Shivraj Bandekar
Already present expired, removed and installed freshly. 2 User and 3 years (Not a renewal key)
Reviewed in India on 26 March 2024
Verified Purchase
Already present expired, removed and installed freshly on 2 laptops.
2 User and 3 years (Not a renewal key)

It was present already in expired state. I was afraid to buy renewal product.
when i tried to renew old one, got message `renewal key found in multiuser batch`.
Uninstalled from both laptops and restarted it and installed freshly.
On first installation software asked for details and otp verification (email and mobile).
For second on its took same information.
Try to install on same day on both laptop.
Once i purchased on amazon they send keys within one hour. Mostly takes extra one day from purchase.
Check keys in amazon web (All >> Your Account >> Email alerts, messages, and ads >> Message Centre >> Buyer/Seller Messages >> Activation code for... )
Check keys in amazon Mobile App (You >> Your Account >> Message Centre >> Your Messages >> Buyer/Seller Messages >> Activation code for... )
Note: Path maybe vary after amazon update.

SiNe
Better products available at a cheaper price
Reviewed in India on 10 September 2021
Verified Purchase
I bought this product for my school going kid as it claimed it offered parental control and kids safety. Earlier I had Kaspersky Total Security but that was an aggressive product, kind of truly blocked every website in a particular category. So after reading reviews I decided to pay more than double for the 3 years license and go for Quick Heal. Everything was okay until I decided to run some basic tests on kids safety i.e. access unsafe content. To my surprise all graphic and explicit content was getting downloaded. Even image search with word 'nude' returned tons of porn images. On one hand it did not provide any protection from unsafe sites and other hand blocked WebEx and file access on Microsoft teams. I raised tech support tickets. The response from the QuickHeal team was fast but thennwhat they told me I was shocked. QuickHeal does not provide keyword or content based filtering. So if a website is not yet categorised in thier catalogue it would pass through and you would have to manually add URLs to the block list. Are you guys serious? You expect people to manually block millions of adult and unsafe sites. Is this what QuickHeal claims parental control and kids safety !! Google safe search provides better filtering than this. I hardly used this for 2 days and uninstalled it as does not do what it says it should do. As I write this feedback I am still in contact with the QuickHeal product team as I want them to be transparent on how they advertise and what they offer. Quick heal Total Security is a simple antivirus product + firewall + some fancy features. Parents looking for a product to safeguard their kids computer, I strongly suggest better go for other products. They offer better protection and cheaper too. I have switched back to Kaspersky and happy with my decision. Finally if at all you decide to go for Quick Heal do not buy from TechEzy - Amazon Marketplace. Worst people to do business with. They don't even have courtesy to respond to emails. Finally thanks to Amazon to help me resolve my concerns.
Read more
